story:
SHORT SUMMARY

Present Danger Productions is formed by two core members: Donna Marie Baratta and Jessica Carmichael. Donna Marie and I met while training in the MFA Directing Program at the University of Alberta in Canada. DM and I both share a passion for theatre that asks meaningful and difficult questions of our society when it comes to issues of violence, gender, race, class, familial issues and themes such as the conflicts between love and hate. We founded Present Danger Productions together to bring current and topical issues in our world to Canadian stages, with a focus on new and devised work. This Canadian work by Greg MacArthur speaks to us deeply, in fact we chose it as our first outing together with our new company because of its unique look at female violence. The play explores characters marginalized in some way through gender, sexuality or race.  As female directors, we want to explore why is female violence on the rise? And more importantly- female apathy?  

We believe strongly in our voices as female directors and part of our mandate is to create work that helps redefine and celebrate the unique possibilities of being female- and help give young women a chance to examine where we are at now in terms of looking at females in present pop culture, and how might we fight negative stereotypes. This play also shines a significant light on teen apathy- an issue we wish to probe in terms of how it might be countered- if at all.

OUR CAMPAIGN: Why It's Important

Our campaign is to raise $4,000 towards production costs. Our piece will be part of Toronto's highly regarded and popular 2013 SummerWorks Festival. We need money to cover the cost of all design production elements: set, lights, costume and makeup as well as marketing expenses and festival fees. At this point all our artists involved are working in kind- with the hopes that we may make some money at the box office to split an honorary fee. 

THE MAGNITUDE OF YOUR CONTRIBUTION.

This story needs to be told NOW- with the state of current youth violence we cannot stress the effect this play could have to help change it. To bring more people towards ACTION. Theatre is a dress rehearsal for life- we want people to walk away and think about ways to help stop youth violence. MacArthur's play is about a group of small town teenagers that struggle with feelings of boredom and rage in a place that gives very little hope of anything better to come for them.  Inspired by the murder of Reena Virk and the story of the Columbine shooters, Dylan and Eric, this play revolves around a group of youth that taunt, torture and eventually kill a young girl who ultimately is not too much different from themselves.  The group in question, four fourteen year old youths, both witness and participate in the violence upon their peer.  Although it was written more than a decade ago it still resonates with current problems today, such as bullying in high schools and senseless youth violence.  You need only think back the killing of Kimberly Proctor and Autumn Pasquale, and the beating of Florida cheerleader Victoria Lindsay, to realize that these can no longer be looked at as isolated incidents.  These acts of violence are symptoms of a greater problem in our society: President Obama at present is arguing to help legislate gun control in the United States. The past killing spree at Columbine and the murder of Reena Virk although memories, are relived in the wake of current violence.  Audiences need to grapple with these current issues, and staging this piece keeps this issue in the forefront of our minds.

 

What We Need & What You Get: Breaking it Down

We Need $4,000 to cover set materials, building, costumes, makeup, gore effects, and marketing such as posters, handbills, etc. 

We have quite a few unique perks to offer you as a contributor to our campaign: a thank you in our program, a signed poster by the cast and team of girls!, a complimentary ticket to girls!, a personal video message from our team.

Even if we don't reach our entire fundraising goal- all money will go towards production costs for the play. Every penny truly counts!

 

The Impact

As stated above-we believe this production of girls!girls!girls! will contribute vitally to shining a light on teen violence as an issue that can no longer be ignored. 

 

Not only will the impact of this production help raise awareness and action towards a very serious issue, but this production will also share the talents of a team of artists committed to creating politically and socially relevant theatre. The production team is mostly comprised of recent University of Alberta graduates, and/or established and recognized Toronto artists. Our Cast is either a present or recently graduated theatre student from two of the leading training programs for actors in Canada. You are supporting the collaboration of emerging and established artists in the Toronto scene, all of whom are committed to this profession.

Please meet our team: 

CREATIVE TEAM

Directors: Donna Marie Baratta and Jessica Carmichael

Playwright: Greg MacArthur

Set & Light Designer: Nick Blais

Costume Designer: Erin T. Gruber

Makeup & Gore Effects: Haley Reap

Sound Designer:  Scott Christian

Fight Director:  Daniel Levinson

Voice and Text Coach:  Mark Ingram 

CAST

Splitz: Jackie Rowland

Puss: Bridget Wareham

Jam: Zoe Cleland

Little Bucky: Ben Wheelwright

Missy: Lindsey Middleton

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to fund the campaign with $$- we still appreciate your support! You can certainly spread the word about our campaign to friends and colleagues and family. We would appreciate any noise you can make about our production- we want to get people out to our show and talking- that kind of contribution is as important as money! You can share our campaign on Facebook and twitter- as well as follow us there where we will be giving updates regarding our process throughout rehearsals. Please don't forget the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Summary

Hello!  Derik Iverson and Maggie Mitchell here!  We are the co-founders of Making Rain Productions, a new production company that keeps teamwork and respect for the artist at its core.

                   

In November of 2014, we produced our first production, Songs for a New World by Jason Robert Brown at Stage 773 in Chicago. We were so fortunate that our debut production had a sold out run, our cast and crew truly embodied teamwork and we had a great experience.  After the success of our first ever foray into producing in Chicago, we were in love with the process and the product, and knew we had to continue. Songs for a New World was 100% funded out of our own pockets and we were grateful to break even, but that’s not a business model that will work forever, so for this next venture we are asking for help!


Our next production in July, 2015 will be Coronado by Dennis Lehane, the American author who also wrote Shutter Island, Mystic River, and Gone Baby Gone. Coronado is his only play and we are excited to bring it life, literally, as its rarely performed. As a production company, our goal is to support our crew, actors and the production itself, be debt free, and also generate funds to create a foundation for the company’s future.  Derik is directing this play as its one of his all-time favorites. And now that we’ve gotten our feet wet with our first show, he's excited to direct it in a way where we have a game plan, resources, and supporters.  

                                         


Our budget for Coronado is $5,000, which includes rights to the show, set, rental space, costumes, actor and crew stipends and other costs that we all forget about like printing programs, marketing and Starbucks. In addition to the show, we hope to gain funds to cover the cost of the company’s needs such as maintaining the  website, business legal fees and a few cases of PBR for the director.

From this show we hope to jump-start future projects and continue to anchor our mission that all efforts from all artists involved in a Making Rain Productions project will be supported financially and creatively, and empowering individuals through teamwork will remain the number one focal point as we grow and thrive.

We want to thank the Cornservatory, home of Corn Productions for providing the perfect venue for Coronado and being a great start to awesome teamwork on this production.

                                           

We’d also like to thank all of you, ahead of time, for donating your love, support and lunch money to Making Rain Productions. We’ve created a few, fun ways that you can donate and get stuff in return!

Why Coronado 

As thrilling and as dark as Coronado can be, it is ultimately a story of hope. It's an examination of the desperate measures people take to live the life they want to lead. It brings the message that you are not the sum of your past; you are who you want to be. Coronado is a reminder that we are who we are because we choose to be, which we believe is an important message to share. The roles are beautiful and full of depth; a great opportunity for actors. From lighting to sound design, costuming and set, this show has a great script and inventive concept for all creative team members to bring their brilliance to the project and feel proud of what they have contributed and accomplished. Coronado offers a wonderful platform for everyone to "dig in," and we think its important to bring scripts to life that provide an adequate canvas for everyone to play! We are confident in our team, and our hard work and values, our creative talent and vision to produce a deeply affecting and highly entertaining evening of theater!

About the Play

Coronado takes place in a seedy, honky-tonk bar and tells the story of desperate people who have more in common than meets the eye. Lovers Gina and Will plot the murder of Gina's loser-of-a husband, a Doctor and a Patient begin an illicit affair and cross professional boundaries, and Bobby and his Father attempt to piece together the location of a precious diamond and a missing girlfriend. 

These intersecting plot lines illustrate stories of bloody desires that shatter lives and unknowingly change everyone's future. Dennis Lehane's dark rabbit hole of a thriller will have you on the edge of your seat as you piece together secrets, lies, and violent crimes before arriving to a harrowing conclusion you'll never see coming. Coronado is the chilling, cinematic noir you've been waiting to witness on stage.

Other Ways You Can Help 

We understand if money is a little tight. But you can still help!:

  • Let us know if you want to volunteer to be an usher and see the show for free!
  • Shoot us an email if you want to help backstage!
We hope you feel good about supporting local theater, and also getting your tickets to the show early! There are so many options and we are so grateful and excited to put this show on its feet! You’re gonna love it. 
Thank you for helping us MAKE SOME RAIN!

These intersecting plot lines illustrate stories of bloody desires that shatter lives and unknowingly change everyone's future. Dennis Lehane's dark rabbit hole of a thriller will have you on the edge of your seat as you piece together secrets, lies, and violent crimes before arriving to a harrowing conclusion you'll never see coming. Coronado is the chilling, cinematic noir you've been waiting to witness on stage.

Other Ways You Can Help 
 We understand if money is a little tight. But you can still help!:  Let us know if you want to volunteer to be an usher and see the show for free! Shoot us an email if you want to help backstage! 
We hope you feel good about supporting local theater, and also getting your tickets to the show early! There are so many options and we are so grateful and excited to put this show on its feet! You’re gonna love it. 
Thank you for helping us MAKE SOME RAIN!

story:
Project Summary

Created in 2001, the Recognizing Women Project is an annual six month interdisciplinary research and performance initiative led by nathantrice/RITUALS dance theater in collaboration with adolescent and young adult female dancers, and university students enrolled in the humanities and social sciences. The goal of our collaboration is to develop a holistic understanding of women’s unique experiences and contributions, and to create dance theater that reflects those understandings.  This year, the RWP research initiative is developing a new dance entitled "I the object in my eye" that investigates adolescent and young adult female self-objectification in America. With a team of students from Barnard College and Columbia University's women and gender studies and sociology departments, our collaborative aim is to identify the societal, interpersonal, and personal contributions that play a role in female self-objectification.

 

What We Need & What You Get

As we near the end of our six-month creative process, there are several unmet needs that threaten the full execution of the project. Currently, we are in need of additional managerial, research and artists rehearsal salaries in the amount of $15,000.00. We are asking for your support by making a donation today of any size to help us meet our goal and completely realize the RWP research initiative. Your contributions create significant momentum towards the completion of this unique and timely project. 

Besides helping us use art as a platform to bring awareness and provoke activism around women’s concerns, we have a list of perks available to those who support the Recognizing Women Project, from a signed poster, to complimentary performance tickets, to an inside look at our creative process. We want you to be involved in the company and the conversations we are having!

nathantrice/RITUALS is a sponsored artist underneath Performance Zone Inc. (dba The Field), a not-for-profit, tax exempt, 501(c)(3) organization serving the performing arts community, and your donation to the company and to the Recognizing Women Project is tax-deductible.

 

The Impact

From the beginning of this season of the RWP, the company, research team, high school & young adult dancers have rigorously engaged in weekly personal story telling and self-inquiry to better understand themselves. The opportunity for each person to revisit their stories has allowed each person to develop a deeper understanding and critical lens into how and why their life situations govern their identity, and how they make choices to best navigate their situations. This brought up the question: is identity situational?  As we explored this inquiry, new perspectives and insights emerged, affording everyone with new language around the fluidity of identity as it pertains to ones situation, and the understanding and importance of self-awareness, self-agency and self-accountability.

These kinds of artistic educational processes are the heart & soul of the RWP and cannot happen without your support. Help us bring this project into the next year.  Your donations are the foundation of the Recognizing Women Project's annual commitment to raising awareness around women's experiences and contributions.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The Recognizing Women Project is about having ongoing conversations about the social, cultural, and political structures that impact women. This is just one of the conversations that nathantrice/RITUALS is involved in, and our goal is to extend these conversations into the community for the long term. Other ways you can support is to help bring awareness to this project by finding us either on our website, Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter (stay tuned for a blog!), and tell a friend, tell your friend’s friends and help connect any and all women's groups, organizations and communities to our cause. Our company is based on creating community-based initiatives that reflect contemporary and historical social climates, and we want to hear what you have to say!

 

Performance Dates

The Recognizing Women Project will premier at                                                                                          Kumble Theater at LIU Brooklyn
One University Plaza, Brooklyn, NY, 11201

March 16th: 7:30pm
March 17th: 7:30pm
March 18th: 2:00pm, 7:30pm

Tickets available at www.kumbletheater.org or
Kumble Theater box office at 718-488-1624

nathantrice/RITUALS’ mission is to create and present art that reflects the importance of humanism, through projects that examine gender, identity, and culture. The company has been in residence at the Restoration Plaza Center for Arts and Culture since 2005, and has toured nationally and internationally for some of the most prestigious festivals around the globe. For more information on nathantrice/RITUALS, please visit www.nathantricerituals.com.

story:
What is BRTW?

Black Revolutionary Theatre Workshop is an independent group of NYC-based Black artists seeking to explore, craft, produce, and perform Black experiences and responses to systemic oppression. Founded shortly after the massacre at Mother Emanuel AME, BRTW places a premium on ensuring that Black voices are not silenced and that Black identities are not lost in stereotypes.

As the Black community grapples with the injustices it faces from without and the privileges from within, BRTW seeks to create a space to critically engage with the layers of intersectional identity and justice while constantly asking, “What does true liberation look like?”

Our last production, Revolution, toured to colleges in Connecticut and Vermont, and wove together various narratives of a 20th century race war.

We are currently writing and planning our next production season, which will include theatrical productions, workshops, podcasts and video content--but we can't accomplish this without your help. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Being an artist in New York is hard, and it's especially hard when you're a group of overworked, underpaid twenty-somethings. Our goal is to raise $5,000 in 30 days. This may seem like a lot, but compare this to the average production cost of one Off-Off Broadway show-$18,000-and you'll find that it's actually quite tiny.*

But what do we need it for? Here's where the money goes:

  • Securing LLC status
  • Fractured Atlas (fiscal sponsorship) fees
  • PO Box
  • Meeting and Rehearsal Space
  • Email Hosting
  • Business Bank Account
  • Web Hosting/Wordpress
  • Internet Domain
  • Administrative Assistance
  • Props and Costumes
  • Transportation
  • Coffee!!! (only half kidding)

As of right now we're paying for all of this up-front. We repay ourselves with money from commissions and touring projects, but launching a production is expensive and drains not only our company account but our own pockets.

In the face of major shifts in the zeitgeist, freedom of speech and protest become all the more valuable. We seek to amplify the voices and stories of the marginalized, and to provide a jumping off point for further action. Your tax-deductible contributions will help us make a world of difference.

To show our thanks, here's what we're prepared to offer:

  • Virtual Fist-Bumps!
  • Special Thanks in our Program Notes!
  • Special Thanks Out-Loud!
  • Reserved Seating at a BRTW Performance!
  • Professionally Taught Cooking, Yoga and Self-Defense Classes!
  • Digital Marketing Consultation!
  • AND MORE!!!**
 

Other Ways to Help

We get it: times are hard and not everyone has a dollar to spare. If you'd like to support us in other ways, here are some things you can do:

  • Get the word out: Share this campaign with your friends and family via the indiegogo share tools. And if you'd like us to come to your community let us know-we'd love to come out!
  • Follow us on social media: Keep abreast of BRTW updates including future performances, tours and ways to join in. We're on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.
  • Check out our shop: Peruse our BRTW goods and put us on your holiday wish list.  Wear your support on your sleeve!
  • Send us in-kind donations: Not all contributions have to be monetary. If you have spare office supplies, NY rehearsal or meeting space, or extra time to help with administrative tasks we'd love to hear from you. Contact our co-founder Kevin  here: Kevin@BlackRevolutionaryMedia.com
  • COME SEE A SHOW! When you join our email list you'll automatically get updates on upcoming performances, including a special staged reading of Summoned in downtown Brooklyn on November 17th. Written by company member Sheyenne Javonne Brown, Summoned is a beautiful retelling of the Orpheus and Eurydice myth in the context of the BLM movement in NYC. We want to keep our shows as accessible as possible, so we offer a sliding scale admission. No one will be turned away for the inability to pay.

Thank you so much for your support! We couldn't do it without you.

Black Revolutionary Theater Workshop: 2017 Season Fundraiser is a sponsored project of
Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of BRTW must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the
extent permitted by law.

*NYIT Budget Study, 2008

**Check back weekly for more perks

story:
Go to Gallery tab to see more fun Vampire Cowboys fundraising videos.

Vampire Cowboys, the OBIE Award winning pioneers of geek theater, are busy working on a new project. A top-secret untitled new project...UNTITLED VAMPIRE COWBOYS PROJECT.

UNTITLED VAMPIRE COWBOYS PROJECT is the first new Vampire Cowboys' play in three years to be written by Co-Artistic Director Qui Nguyen. And we are bringing it to the stage for only 4 performances from July 30th to August 2nd. Co-Artistic Director Robert Ross Parker will take the reins to mount this new production as part of the Ice Factory Festival presented by the New Ohio Theatre with a cast that includes Sheldon Best, Jamie Dunn, Tom Myers, and Nicky Schmidlein.   

In a seemingly utopian future, a young lady with unique abilities sets out on a murderous path to keep that world intact. What she doesn't realize is if she fails, the world will go to hell...literally.

We are having so much fun creating this new Qui Nguyen play, with fights, and puppets and projections and songs and more!  But we need a little more help to get it to the stage. 

We need to raise another $6000 to bring all of these elements together and make it a Vampire Cowboys' event.  $6000 will help us to pay our artists for their work both onstage and backstage. Our artists give us their time, their creativity, and their hearts to make our geek-y theater dreams a moving, fighting, fun reality.  Your help makes this work possible.

story:
(Texto en español debajo)

ANDERPLATZ brings together 9 collaborators from Spain, Argentina, Germany, Italy, Austria and the USA for their first theatre-dance show: DETACHED. 

Our goal is to have the premiere in November 2016 in the Dock 11 Theater, Berlin, Germany.

We are a Berlin-based collective of ten professionals from dance, theatre and music, performing and directing with companies such as Familie Flöz, Blue Man Group,  and Faizal Zeghoudi.

The money we hope to raise with this campaign is the minimum required to carry out a project of this scale and will allow us to concentrate our efforts in the final period leading to the premiere in November 2016.


Ad Libitum ad Infinitum

DETACHED is our first piece, but it shouldn‘t be our last! ANDERPLATZ is aiming to establish itself as a company in contemporary theater. Your contribution to this premiere may give us the push we need to get things rolling. We aren‘t only driven by short-term success, but also by long-term evolution!


The Piece

The stories we tell in DETACHED (to a curious and open-minded international audience) live in the uncertain but are concrete, they are wise and naive, they are both comforting and sad, they play in their own world, but are at the same time part of contemporary society. DETACHED is clever, brutal and funny, and at the same time, very vulnerable.


The Collective

When we started meeting to improvise and develop material for this piece two years ago, we had expected that exciting things might happen. But we were utterly overwhelmed by the powerful alchemy that was created in this special combination of performers from various disciplines and different cultural backgrounds.

 In our work, the concept of the dancer, actor and musician gradually melt together. We are in search of a visual and physical theatre: a vivid mix of concrete and abstract scenes. The body, the soul, music, space and language are the performers’ tools.


Your Support Matters!

Developing a project of this scale with a group from six different countries has not been easy. But despite the difficulties our trust in the value of this project has only grown since we have come together almost two years ago.

 Being highly trained and experienced professionals, we all know that covering essential costs is crucial to the concentration and quality of the production process. If you believe in the idea as much as we do, we would really appreciate your help. Your investment in DETACHED will surely be worth it!


Budget structure

To give you an idea of the items on which your contribution will be spent, here is a list of things we need in order to get serious about staging DETACHED:

  • Rehearsal space rent          1.254 €
  • Travel costs                              700 €  
  • Housing                                      400 € 
  • Costumes                                  500 € 
  • Stage set                                    400 € 
  • Transport                                   100 € 
  • Technical equipment             400 € 
  • Post cards                                  100 € 
  • Website                                       100 € 
  • Performers‘ fees                   3000 €

Please note: Being able to turn down other (paid) work in the last month before the premiere has a direct effect on our commitment as performers. The estimated rehearsal fee of 300 € for each performer will help in a small way to make this possible.

We also still have a pool of helping hands we would like to pay: costume designer, stage set designer, dramaturg, lighting designer, helpers in organization, website designer, photographer, video editing. Should we surpass our goal, any remaining funds will be spent on these items.


Ways You Can Help

  • Check out our fantastic perks and help us reach this campaign's goal! Every single contribution is so important to us and will be a gigantic help!
  • Of course, any financial contribution is welcome, even if you don't choose a perk!
  • Spread the word as much as possible about the campaign via E-Mail, facebook, twitter, on the phone, at parties, at dinner, or when you call your mommy! Once you've done that, start over!
  • If you would like to support Anderplatz outside of the online campaign, please contact us.
  • There are many ways you can help out without donating money. Like to cook? bring us your favorite dish at lunchtime and have a chat with us. Got a van? Transport equipment for us. Writer? Put us in your blog. Any other ideas? Contact us for any non-monetary contribution you'ld like to make.

...........................................................................................................................................

ESPAÑOL

ANDERPLATZ está conformado por 9 colaboradores provenientes de España, Argentina, Alemania, Italia, Austria y EEUU, su primer espectáculo es DETACHED (Desprendido), un pieza de danza-teatro. 

Nuestro objetivo es estrenar en Noviembre 2016 en el teatro Dock 11 de Berlín, Alemania. 

Somos un colectivo, con sede en Berlín, de profesionales  de la danza, el teatro y la música, actualmente actuando y/o dirigiendo compañías como Familie Flöz, Blue Man Group y Faizal Zeghoudi.

El dinero que esperamos recaudar con esta campaña es el mínimo requerido para llevar a cabo este proyecto, y permitirá concentrar nuestros esfuerzos en la fase final de este período: el estreno en noviembre de este año.


Ad Libitum ad Infinitum
DETACHED es nuestro primer espectáculo pero no queremos que sea el último. La intención de  ANDERPLATZ es establecerse como compañía de teatro contemporáneo. Tu contribución para posibilitar este estreno nos dará el empujón necesario para que las cosas empiecen a rodar! No nos interesa lograr un acontecimiento  eventual sino que apostamos por una evolución a largo plazo!


El espectáculo  

Las historias que contamos en DETACHED para un público internacional viven en lo incierto, pero son concretas, son sabias e ingenuas al mismo tiempo, son tanto tristes como reconfortantes, suceden en un mundo particular, pero a su vez pueden extrapolarse a nuestra sociedad contemporánea. DETACHED es inteligente, cruel y divertida, y ,al mismo tiempo, vulnerable.


El colectivo

Cuando hace dos años iniciamos nuestros encuentros, para improvisar juntos y crear material para esta obra, esperábamos que nuestro trabajo fuera interesante y productivo. Pero la poderosa alquimia que surgió en esta combinación especial de artistas provenientes de países y disciplinas diversas superó claramente nuestras expectativas.

 En nuestro trabajo, a menudo el concepto de bailarín, actor o músico se mezclan entre ellos. Buscamos realizar un teatro visual y corporal: una mezcla fresca entre escenas abstractas y concretas. El cuerpo, el alma, la música, el espacio y el lenguaje son las herramientas que usamos como performers.


Tu apoyo cuenta!

Llevar a cabo un proyecto de esta escala con un grupo proveniente de países distintos no ha sido fácil. Pero a pesar de las dificultades nuestra confianza en el valor de este proyecto ha ido creciendo desde que empezamos a trabajar juntos dos años atrás. 

Siendo profesionales con vasta experiencia, sabemos que cubrir los gastos básicos es fundamental para la concentración y calidad del proceso de producción. Si confías en esta idea, apreciaremos totalmente tu ayuda. Tu inversión en DETACHED, da por seguro, merece la pena!


Gastos

Para darte una idea como será utilizada tu contribución, hemos hecho una lista de lo que necesitamos alcanzar para poder llevar seriamente DETACHED al escenario:

  • Alquiler del espacio para ensayos       1.254 €
  • Gastos de viaje                                               700 € 
  • Alojamiento                                                     400 € 
  • Vestuario                                                          500 € 
  • Escenografía                                                   400 € 
  • Transporte                                                        100 € 
  • Equipo técnico                                                400 € 
  • Flyers                                                                  100 € 
  • Website                                                              100 € 
  • Honorario Performers                               3000 €

Nota: Poder dejar otras ocupaciones el último mes antes del estreno tendrá un efecto directo en nuestro compromiso con el proyecto. Un honorario por cada performer de 300 € por el período de ensayos nos acerca a este objetivo. 

A su vez, tenemos una lista de personas que nos ayudan a las que nos gustaría recompensar: vestuarista, escenógrafo, dramaturga, diseñador de luces, ayudantes en el trabajo organizativo, diseñador de la web, fotógrafo, editor de vídeo. En el caso de que sobrepasemos nuestro objetivo (sería maravilloso!), esta cantidad irá destinada a estos fines.


Como puedes ayudarnos

  • Tenemos tentadoras recompensas que puedes adquirir con tu donación. Cada contribución es muy importante cualquiera sea su dimensión y será una gran ayuda para nosotros!
  • también es posible donar la cantidad de dinero que desees sin adquirir una recompensa.
  • también nos ayudas difundiendo la campaña lo mas posible a través de e-mails, facebook, twitter o por teléfono, en fiestas, o cuando hables con amigos!
  • si deseas apoyar nuestro proyecto fuera de la campaña online, por favor no dudes en contactarnos.
  • hay muchas maneras en que puedes ayudarnos sin donar dinero. Te gusta cocinar? Puedes traernos el almuerzo en el período de ensayos! Tienes una camioneta? Puedes transportarnos los equipos! O escribe sobre nosotros en tu Blog! otras ideas? Contáctanos para cualquier contribución no monetaria que quieras ofrecernos!
story_txt:
(Texto en español debajo)ANDERPLATZ brings together 9 collaborators from Spain, Argentina, Germany, Italy, Austria and the USA for their first theatre-dance show: DETACHED. 

Our goal is to have the premiere in November 2016 in the Dock 11 Theater, Berlin, Germany.

We are a Berlin-based collective of ten professionals from dance, theatre and music, performing and directing with companies such as Familie Flöz, Blue Man Group,  and Faizal Zeghoudi.

The money we hope to raise with this campaign is the minimum required to carry out a project of this scale and will allow us to concentrate our efforts in the final period leading to the premiere in November 2016. 

Ad Libitum ad InfinitumDETACHED is our first piece, but it shouldn‘t be our last! ANDERPLATZ is aiming to establish itself as a company in contemporary theater. Your contribution to this premiere may give us the push we need to get things rolling. We aren‘t only driven by short-term success, but also by long-term evolution!The Piece
The stories we tell in DETACHED (to a curious and open-minded international audience) live in the uncertain but are concrete, they are wise and naive, they are both comforting and sad, they play in their own world, but are at the same time part of contemporary society. DETACHED is clever, brutal and funny, and at the same time, very vulnerable.

The CollectiveWhen we started meeting to improvise and develop material for this piece two years ago, we had expected that exciting things might happen. But we were utterly overwhelmed by the powerful alchemy that was created in this special combination of performers from various disciplines and different cultural backgrounds.
 In our work, the concept of the dancer, actor and musician gradually melt together. We are in search of a visual and physical theatre: a vivid mix of concrete and abstract scenes. The body, the soul, music, space and language are the performers’ tools.

Your Support Matters!
Developing a project of this scale with a group from six different countries has not been easy. But despite the difficulties our trust in the value of this project has only grown since we have come together almost two years ago.
 Being highly trained and experienced professionals, we all know that covering essential costs is crucial to the concentration and quality of the production process. If you believe in the idea as much as we do, we would really appreciate your help. Your investment in DETACHED will surely be worth it!

Budget structureTo give you an idea of the items on which your contribution will be spent, here is a list of things we need in order to get serious about staging DETACHED:

Rehearsal space rent          1.254 €

Travel costs                              700 €  

Housing                                      400 € 
Costumes                                  500 € 
Stage set                                    400 € 
Transport                                   100 € 
Technical equipment             400 € 
Post cards                                  100 € 
Website                                       100 € 
Performers‘ fees                   3000 €


Please note: Being able to turn down other (paid) work in the last month before the premiere has a direct effect on our commitment as performers. The estimated rehearsal fee of 300 € for each performer will help in a small way to make this possible.

We also still have a pool of helping hands we would like to pay: costume designer, stage set designer, dramaturg, lighting designer, helpers in organization, website designer, photographer, video editing. Should we surpass our goal, any remaining funds will be spent on these items. 

Ways You Can Help

Check out our fantastic perks and help us reach this campaign's goal! Every single contribution is so important to us and will be a gigantic help!
Of course, any financial contribution is welcome, even if you don't choose a perk!
Spread the word as much as possible about the campaign via E-Mail, facebook, twitter, on the phone, at parties, at dinner, or when you call your mommy! Once you've done that, start over!

If you would like to support Anderplatz outside of the online campaign, please contact us.


There are many ways you can help out without donating money. Like to cook? bring us your favorite dish at lunchtime and have a chat with us. Got a van? Transport equipment for us. Writer? Put us in your blog. Any other ideas? Contact us for any non-monetary contribution you'ld like to make.




...........................................................................................................................................

ESPAÑOLANDERPLATZ está conformado por 9 colaboradores provenientes de España, Argentina, Alemania, Italia, Austria y EEUU, su primer espectáculo es DETACHED (Desprendido), un pieza de danza-teatro. 
Nuestro objetivo es estrenar en Noviembre 2016 en el teatro Dock 11 de Berlín, Alemania. 
Somos un colectivo, con sede en Berlín, de profesionales  de la danza, el teatro y la música, actualmente actuando y/o dirigiendo compañías como Familie Flöz, Blue Man Group y Faizal Zeghoudi. El dinero que esperamos recaudar con esta campaña es el mínimo requerido para llevar a cabo este proyecto, y permitirá concentrar nuestros esfuerzos en la fase final de este período: el estreno en noviembre de este año.Ad Libitum ad InfinitumDETACHED es nuestro primer espectáculo pero no queremos que sea el último. La intención de  ANDERPLATZ es establecerse como compañía de teatro contemporáneo. Tu contribución para posibilitar este estreno nos dará el empujón necesario para que las cosas empiecen a rodar! No nos interesa lograr un acontecimiento  eventual sino que apostamos por una evolución a largo plazo! 
El espectáculo  Las historias que contamos en DETACHED para un público internacional viven en lo incierto, pero son concretas, son sabias e ingenuas al mismo tiempo, son tanto tristes como reconfortantes, suceden en un mundo particular, pero a su vez pueden extrapolarse a nuestra sociedad contemporánea. DETACHED es inteligente, cruel y divertida, y ,al mismo tiempo, vulnerable. 
El colectivoCuando hace dos años iniciamos nuestros encuentros, para improvisar juntos y crear material para esta obra, esperábamos que nuestro trabajo fuera interesante y productivo. Pero la poderosa alquimia que surgió en esta combinación especial de artistas provenientes de países y disciplinas diversas superó claramente nuestras expectativas.
 En nuestro trabajo, a menudo el concepto de bailarín, actor o músico se mezclan entre ellos. Buscamos realizar un teatro visual y corporal: una mezcla fresca entre escenas abstractas y concretas. El cuerpo, el alma, la música, el espacio y el lenguaje son las herramientas que usamos como performers. 

Tu apoyo cuenta!
Llevar a cabo un proyecto de esta escala con un grupo proveniente de países distintos no ha sido fácil. Pero a pesar de las dificultades nuestra confianza en el valor de este proyecto ha ido creciendo desde que empezamos a trabajar juntos dos años atrás. 
Siendo profesionales con vasta experiencia, sabemos que cubrir los gastos básicos es fundamental para la concentración y calidad del proceso de producción. Si confías en esta idea, apreciaremos totalmente tu ayuda. Tu inversión en DETACHED, da por seguro, merece la pena!

GastosPara darte una idea como será utilizada tu contribución, hemos hecho una lista de lo que necesitamos alcanzar para poder llevar seriamente DETACHED al escenario:

Alquiler del espacio para ensayos       1.254 €
Gastos de viaje                                               700 € 
Alojamiento                                                     400 € 
Vestuario                                                          500 € 
Escenografía                                                   400 € 
Transporte                                                        100 € 
Equipo técnico                                                400 € 
Flyers                                                                  100 € 
Website                                                              100 € 
Honorario Performers                               3000 €


Nota: Poder dejar otras ocupaciones el último mes antes del estreno tendrá un efecto directo en nuestro compromiso con el proyecto. Un honorario por cada performer de 300 € por el período de ensayos nos acerca a este objetivo. 
A su vez, tenemos una lista de personas que nos ayudan a las que nos gustaría recompensar: vestuarista, escenógrafo, dramaturga, diseñador de luces, ayudantes en el trabajo organizativo, diseñador de la web, fotógrafo, editor de vídeo. En el caso de que sobrepasemos nuestro objetivo (sería maravilloso!), esta cantidad irá destinada a estos fines.

Como puedes ayudarnos


Tenemos tentadoras recompensas que puedes adquirir con tu donación. Cada contribución es muy importante cualquiera sea su dimensión y será una gran ayuda para nosotros!
también es posible donar la cantidad de dinero que desees sin adquirir una recompensa.
también nos ayudas difundiendo la campaña lo mas posible a través de e-mails, facebook, twitter o por teléfono, en fiestas, o cuando hables con amigos!
si deseas apoyar nuestro proyecto fuera de la campaña online, por favor no dudes en contactarnos.
hay muchas maneras en que puedes ayudarnos sin donar dinero. Te gusta cocinar? Puedes traernos el almuerzo en el período de ensayos! Tienes una camioneta? Puedes transportarnos los equipos! O escribe sobre nosotros en tu Blog! otras ideas? Contáctanos para cualquier contribución no monetaria que quieras ofrecernos!

story:
Hello, 

My name is Kalin Mitov and I am the director of this event.

Тhe 2015 Same Sex Ballroom Dancing Championship is not only a dance competition, but also a public declaration of the need for equality at all levels of our lives. It supports the diversity and acceptance of the youth and adult LGBTQ community.

The 2015 US Same Sex Ballroom Dance Championship is a two-day show and competition, outlining the grace and skills of the ballroom dance contestants accompanied with intervals of social ballroom dancing, games with the audience and professional dance performances. 

Welcomed speech at the Opening Ceremony will be from State Representative  Sarah Peake.

Doors opening at 5:30pm with VIP Champaign time. Competition starts at 6pm with preliminary rounds. After awarding the winners and 2015 US Champions we will have social dance and ballroom dance party.

The featuring are disciplines like Argentine Tango, Salsa, Hustle, Country Western Polka, Two Step and West Coast Swing as well as the traditional Waltz, Tango, Foxtrot, Cha-cha Rumba, Jive  and more…(full list you can find in the website). The competition will proceed by the rules of the dancesport organization governing such ballroom dance competitions- North American Same Sex Partner Dance Association (NASSPDA).

The Championship is the only same-sex ballroom dance contest in New England. After its  two annual events in 2013  and 2014 NASSPDA Executive Board had awarded us the privilege to host the 2015 US Championship.

This event will benefit the general population- 18 years old and above; man, woman and transgender. It is open to everybody especially supporting the LGBTQ community. One of the main goals is to introduce ballroom dancing as an outlet, a safe environment and an alternative pro-social event for the young LGBTQ. Such event is teaching them about partnership, understanding, tolerance, and responsibility not only on the dance floor but in life.

We are expecting 100 competitors from Montreal, Toronto and Vancouver Canada, New York, Connecticut, Rode Island, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, Maine, Philadelphia, Florida, Maryland, Washington DC, California and many other states. The venue can host 300 spectators and most of them will be from Greater Boston and New England as well as friends and supporters of the competitive couples.

The dance competition is a yearly event that embraces equality and acceptance among the mainstream and LGBTQ communities through one form of artistic performance - artistic and competitive same-sex ballroom dancing.

 

Supporter of the events so far are:

Seaglass Inn and Spa- hotel host for competitors

Scott Alligretti and Dental Arts

Tourist Visitor Board of Ptown

Eastern Bank

David Orr LMT

Bay State Cruise

Stop and Shop

The Inn at 7 Central

Somerset House Inn

Surfside hotel and Suites

Anchor Inn

Admiral’s Landing

Tin Pan Alley

Preliminary Schedule:

Friday, September 18th

6pm VIP Opening

preliminary round

social dancing

games

US Championship awards

8pm Ballroom Dance Party


Saturday, September 19th

6pm Opening

Single dances

preliminary rounds

games

Provincetown Dance Trophy awards

9pm Ends


Тhe Championship is not only a ballroom dance competition, but also a public declaration of the need for equality at all levels of our lives. It supports the diversity and acceptance of the youth and adult LGBTQ community.


Event Organizing Committee:

Kalin Mitov - Director

Tedi Eaton - Community Relations Coordinator

Nordis Glasoe - Accounting and Registration

Linda Toomey - On Deck Captain and Design

Don Jaffee, MD - Fundraising and Technical Support

The primary costs are associated with the venue including associated lighting and audio visual equipment. But there is also a need to make people aware of the event, to attract attendees and competitors, and the advertising necessary to reach those audiences is quite costly.

Our revenue has not allowed us to compensate our judges at  market rates and we have not been able to reward the winners financially, as other competitions of this type do.

We lack the large sponsorships that allow the traditional dance events to survive and continue year to year, so we are looking to you to help us  perpetuate this new tradition for the LGBT community.

If we are not able to cover our costs, as was the case last year - our first year of this competition - we will not be able to repeat this valuable  opportunity for the LGBT community in the years to come, thus eliminating a rare opportunity for the LGBT community to express themselves creatively.

We are, therefore,  trying to raise $5,500 to cover the baseline costs, and if donations allow, recognize the winners with a financial reward and expand the advertising budget to reach more audiences. 



About the Director, Kalin Mitov: Kalin is not new to the same-sex ballroom dance scene, having won both US and North American Same-Sex Champion titles for the last 3 years, as well as being the European Same-Sex Champion Bronze Medalist. In December 2012, he organized a fundraiser at Club Purgatory in Provincetown, MA, raising more than $2,000 to support the It Gets Better Project, an anti-bullying initiative. He and his previous dance partner created a YouTube video about how ballroom dancing helped them to take a stand against gay bullying. The first Boston same-sex dance competition, held last year,  was a major success due to Kalin's organization of the event,  the convenience of Boston’s outstanding location and, most importantly, the inclusion of everyone, ranging in age from young college students to adult LGBT dancers. 

Most recently he was part of the adjudicators panel of the DanceSport event during the Gay Games 9 in Cleveland, making this competition an unforgettable life time experience.

story:
PURPOSE OF THIS CAMPAIGN:

To create two crowd funded Audience Choice Awards

We are launching our Audience Choice Awards where you the audience can vote for your favourite Artist/dance work.

There are two awards – one award for one of the Mainstage series’ Artist and one award for one of WYSIWYG artists.

To help reward and support dance artists.

This year's dance artists include:
Andrew Tay/Wants&Needs danse
Lina Cruz/Fila 13 Productions
Kate Hilliard
Marie France Forcier
Throwdown Collective
Troy Emery Twigg 
Jacob Niedzwiecki
Susie Burpee
Benjamin Landsberg Dance Projects
Louise Moyes docuDance
Parts+Labour_Danse
Alysa Pires

dance: made in canada/fait au canada (d:mic/fac) Festival 2015 

(d:mic/fac) is Toronto's only biennial contemporary dance festival. The festival strives to:

·  Present work by Canadian choreographers who possess unique artistic visions and come from all cultural backgrounds.

·  Present artists based on artistic merit, regardless of whether they are emerging, mid-career and or established; it is the artists’ commitment to their own vision that holds weight as we curate.

·  Providing a platform for experimentation and collaboration with other arts disciplines, cross-pollinating artists both geographically and experientially.

·  Contributing to arts education in our community through a spectrum of engagement activities.

·  Making the arts accessible to the public.


(d:mic/fac) is a curated festival that provides a stable platform for the presentation of professional Canadian dance works by artists of all ages and cultural backgrounds.  Each festival’s MainStage programs are curated by festival director Yvonne Ng, and two invited curators who select artists based on their particular aesthetic.

There are three components to d:mic/fac:

MainStage: Features a maximum of nine artists/companies - three per program and each program will have three performances over a week. Yvonne Ng, Debashis Sinha (Toronto) and Tedd Robinson (Ottawa) are the curators of the 2015 MainStage.

What You See Is What You Get (WYSIWYG): Features 5 artists – a late-night lottery-based presentation for professional artists. There are two performances of this program.

Art Encounters: is programming curated and commissioned by Yvonne as part of d:mic/fac’s audience development and engagement strategy. It isn’t all about dance on stage.  The Arts Encounters program gives a platform to dance artists who are expressing themselves through a medium other than dance. 

2013 Audience Choice Award Winners Throwdown Collective: 

Receiving the Audience Choice Award helped us in many ways. It was a wonderful boost of confidence for our small but growing collective , helping to raise the status of our little company. Most of all, the recognition helped encourage and inspire us to keep moving forward in producing our work! 

Other ways to help:

Donating is not the only way to help our festival succeed.

Share our campaign with friends, family and on social media.
Visit us during the festival. August 13th - 16th at the Betty Oliphant Theatre. Come see some dance!
Volunteer during the festival: our festival depends on the generosity of our volunteer team.

 Visit http://princessproductions.ca/dance/what-we-do/...

story:
What We Need

We need $1000 to support the 2016 BFD Festival and support the continuation of BFD. Your contribution will allow more of the festival proceeds to go towards the director scholarships!

  • Postcards = $65
  • Stage Managers = $400
  • Front of House = $200
  • Taxes = $60
  • Indiegogo credit = $50
  • One Director Scholarship = $225

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, and whatever else makes ya happy. 
  • Call up a friend and ask them to donate.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
During the day at Wasteland Weekend, it is hot and festering. Help us build a cool, enclosed space to hang out at and watch movies during the day as we move from night to day!  

We're entering our 6th year as the definitive Post Apocalyptic Film Festival, taking place only at Wasteland Weekend each year (the 4 day, fully themed, costume mandatory post apocalyptic party in the desert), featuring independent films from around the world, and now we need your help to make a Daytime Air Conditioned Movie Theater happen at WW 2017 and beyond!

Campaign breakdown: 
4,000 will go to WW to build our daytime theater. 
400 will go toward fees
That leaves 600, 300 for a new laptop and 300 to go toward prize support for 2017, so we can offer free entry to filmmakers for next year and still give the winners something (free entry will mean more entries, and since we're moving to the day, we'll have more space to fill).

Take a look at some of our past winners, and if you like what you see, please help us bring WW even more cool films like these:

Welcome to the Badlands (Runner Up for Grand Post Apocalyptic Prize) 2016): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pawGRWgVrLU

Grave Shivers (Winner Best Alternate Film 2016): https://vimeo.com/100371988

Double-Blind No.1 (Winner Best Alternative Film 2015): https://vimeo.com/119089169

Atheum's Way (Winner Best Animated Film 2015): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VeEgqp8MUY0

KNTRLR “XXX” (Winner Best Music Video 2015): https://vimeo.com/102595129

The Yellow Generation (Winner Best Animated Film 2014): https://vimeo.com/97636001

Gamma Haze "Bodies" Music Video (Winner Best Music Video 2014): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_kFtpwiZenM

Normally, we have to wait until dark to begin our 3 night film festival due to where we're set up, but the intention was always to eventually set up an indoor theater at the WW event. 

After receiving a quote to get this theater built to our specifications with room for expansion in the future, I'm now reaching out to the WW and filmmaking community. An indoor theater would allow those who attend the event a place to escape the heat during the day and give us more time to show films (Noon to 7 pm vs 7:40 to 1:00 am).

We already have the space, we merely need to convert it so that A, it is dark enough for projected films, and B, cool enough, and C, able to be put up and broken down each year without trouble (since Wasteland Weekend is a once a year event where the entire event is set up, then torn down immediately afterward). Please help us make this a reality!


At the very least, we need 4,400 to cover the daytime theater and the fees. If we don't raise enough this time, we'll have less to raise for the next time we do this and we will keep doing this until we hit our mark!

Every pledge of $10 or more will get a special edition Wasteland Film Festival Fundraiser Bottlecap!
story_txt: During the day at Wasteland Weekend, it is hot and festering. Help us build a cool, enclosed space to hang out at and watch movies during the day as we move from night to day!  We're entering our 6th year as the definitive Post Apocalyptic Film Festival, taking place only at Wasteland Weekend each year (the 4 day, fully themed, costume mandatory post apocalyptic party in the desert), featuring independent films from around the world, and now we need your help to make a Daytime Air Conditioned Movie Theater happen at WW 2017 and beyond!Campaign breakdown: 4,000 will go to WW to build our daytime theater. 400 will go toward feesThat leaves 600, 300 for a new laptop and 300 to go toward prize support for 2017, so we can offer free entry to filmmakers for next year and still give the winners something (free entry will mean more entries, and since we're moving to the day, we'll have more space to fill).Take a look at some of our past winners, and if you like what you see, please help us bring WW even more cool films like these:Welcome to the Badlands (Runner Up for Grand Post Apocalyptic Prize) 2016): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pawGRWgVrLUGrave Shivers (Winner Best Alternate Film 2016): https://vimeo.com/100371988Double-Blind No.1 (Winner Best Alternative Film 2015): https://vimeo.com/119089169Atheum's Way (Winner Best Animated Film 2015): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VeEgqp8MUY0KNTRLR “XXX” (Winner Best Music Video 2015): https://vimeo.com/102595129The Yellow Generation (Winner Best Animated Film 2014): https://vimeo.com/97636001Gamma Haze "Bodies" Music Video (Winner Best Music Video 2014): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_kFtpwiZenMNormally, we have to wait until dark to begin our 3 night film festival due to where we're set up, but the intention was always to eventually set up an indoor theater at the WW event. After receiving a quote to get this theater built to our specifications with room for expansion in the future, I'm now reaching out to the WW and filmmaking community. story:
Co-founded in 2010 by Artistic Director Kat Richter, The Lady Hoofers Tap Ensemble has grown from 2 dancers to 14 including a First Company & Apprentices, plus a youth ensemble ranging from 6 to 15 dancers annually. In just six years, we have performed at Philadelphia's City Hall, The Kimmel Center, The Forrest Theatre, The Wilma Theatre, Suzanne Roberts Theater, Adrienne Theater, The Trocadero, as well as offering free community performances and touring throughout New Jersey and the greater Philadelphia area.

Currently under the direction of Richter and Managing Director Katie Budris, the mission of The Lady Hoofers Tap Ensemble is to provide educational resources and professional performance opportunities, particularly for women, to promote the art of rhythm tap.

As we grow, we need your help to sustain our momentum! Last year, your generous donations helped us produce our first rhythm tap short film, "Dollar", which has been selected for the Trans(m)it International Film Festival and is recognized as one of the festival's best films. THANK YOU!

We have several new and ongoing projects in the works, but once again, we can't complete them all without your support.


Visiting Choreographer:
As part of our mission to provide performance and choreographic opportunities to women in tap, we are partnering with up-and-coming NYC tap dancer Dolores Sanchez on a new project. A multi-disciplined dancer, Dolores' innovative choreography pushes the expectations of tap to include synthetic sound and modern movement. Dolores will travel to Philadelphia twice to set a new work on The Lady Hoofers. This will be our first commissioned work choreographed by a dancer outside our company, an exciting step for the ensemble. We plan to premiere the work at our spring concert, a new annual event.

Residency Program at Moffett Elementary School:
Supported by The Bartol Foundation, Mascher Space Coop, and Access to the Arts, this fall we will enter our fourth year residency offering tap classes to 5th graders at Moffett Elementary School. This program provides tap shoes for every student and extends an opportunity for 60+ students to experience the arts in spite of budget cuts taking extra-curriculars away from their school. In our previous season, we expanded into the spring and the students were able to perform in both December and May at their school assemblies. First Company dancer Deedee Mann will continue directing the program and has even more ambitious ideas to expand our outreach education.

Master Classes:
We are committed to bringing master instructors for all ages and levels, making high-quality tap accessible to dancers in Philly who may not be able to travel. Past instructors have included Roxane Butterfly, Karen Callaway Williams, Andrew Nemr, Sarah Mason, and Dolores Sanchez. We are in communication with several of today's hottest tappers in hopes of creating a series with multiple instructors annually that would allow students to pre-register for the entire series at a discount. We also plan to begin a week-long summer intensive for kids and teens to continue their training in a professional environment when their dance studios take a break.

Ticket sales only cover a portion of our production costs, so we rely on individual donors like you to keep raising the profile of rhythm tap in Philadelphia.

Your tax-deductible donation will be used to:

  • continue the projects outlined above

  • cover rehearsal space fees and costumes

  • bring in guest artists for performances and educational opportunities

  • choreographer and dancer fees

  • scholarships for students to attend master classes and participate in our youth company


The Lady Hoofers is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a nonprofit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of The Lady Hoofers must be made payable to Fractured Atlas and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
Who we are 

Tooth+Nail are Adam, Francois, Harriet and Preben. We founded the company after our graduation from the Ecole Jacques Lecoq in Paris, where the four of us met on our first day at the school and have continued to work together ever since! We are an international company, from France, England, Scotland and Norway, and we tell original, devised stories that combine humour and darkness in a visually rich and highly physical style. 

We have just finished a wonderful run of our first show, Parlour Games, at Prague Fringe Festival, where we won the Inspiration Award for the best new show! Hummingbird is our second show as a company, and we are premiering it at the Edinburgh Fringe this August. 

Take a peek at our website: www.toothandnailtheatre.com

'Incredibly skilled!' A Younger Theatre

'Electrifying! A joy from beginning to end.' Fringe Review HIGHLY RECOMMENDED SHOW

(Praise for Parlour Games)

 

What is Hummingbird about? 

Lonely? Single? Look no further! Eligible Bachelor seeks Like-minded Female for Romance - and Murder. 

“He had two things in life: a smile and a suit. And he was not afraid to use them.” Edith Cole worked a dead-end job in a funeral parlour. Ralph Conti worked wealthy widows for a quick buck. Neither expected to fall in love. But once they did, they just kept on falling. 

Inspired by the true story of the Lonely Hearts Killers, who gripped the imagination of 1950s America, Hummingbird is dark, fast, funny physical theatre. Tooth+Nail blend acrobatics and action with a striking visual style to tell a deviously touching tale of love and murder.

 

We will preview the show at the Unity Theatre in Liverpool on Saturday 23rd July before we head up to Edinburgh, where we will play in the Aviary at ZOO from 5th - 29th August (not 16th). 

 

You can find teaser trailers, photos and more info on our website:

http://www.toothandnailtheatre.com/ourwork/ 

 

Information about our Preview performance at the Unity can be found here:

http://www.unitytheatreliverpool.co.uk/whats-on... 

 

And find us on the ZOO and EdFringe websites: 

http://zoofestival.co.uk/whats-on/theatre?zid=505  

https://tickets.edfringe.com/whats-on#q=%22Humm...  

 

Why the Fringe is so important

The Fringe remains the best way for young companies to make sure their work is seen by as wide and varied an audience as possible. This includes press and programmers, as well as the people who might make up our future audiences – i.e. you! This is an important chance for us to showcase our work, and hopefully ensure a long life for Hummingbird after the Fringe. 

Last year, crowdfunding helped us to take our first show - Parlour Games - to Edinburgh, and it proved to be a brilliant platform for us to take the show further afield in the future. We have toured to Liverpool and Prague so far and now have opportunities to take the show to Norway, America and Australia!

 

How you can help 

The Fringe is an expensive undertaking for a young theatre company like us, but one which we know is a vital first step in the life of our show. The money we raise will help us to cover the costs of Set, Props and Costume, Insurance, Registration, Accommodation, and in particular - Marketing - in the biggest arts festival in the world, with thousands of shows, we need to stand out!

Any donation at all is hugely appreciated, and we have thought of lots of ways we would like to say Thank You! (Just select one of our perks!) 

Even if you aren't able to make a financial contribution, there are many other ways to support us and be part of the Tooth+Nail team, and for which we are really grateful! For example, by sharing information about the show and this campaign with your friends and family, and most especially by coming to see us in Liverpool or Edinburgh.

 

Thank you for watching and reading. We hope to see you at the Fringe!

story:
In A Clam Shell

I am a mermaid. I always have been a mermaid. Ever since I was a child and found the Pacific Ocean off the Mexican and Hawaiian shores. My first tattoo was a mermaid. My first certification was SCUBA. My first (and only) Hollywood movie that I starred in was a movie about a mermaid who lost her child.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cb74tVTW_2I It's a Disney movie called the Thirteenth Year. But more than that, I feel it! When I can put my head underwater, the whole world and all her dilemmas drown away in my mind.

I am Stephanie Chantel Durelli. I have been an actress, stunt girl, Hawaiian cruise ship worker, fitness model, circus performer, fire-dancer, aerialist, circus talent manager, show producer, theatre director, and yes, you guessed it, a mermaid. In June of 2013 started my own performance troupe called IRIDESCENCE: A Mermaid Tribe where I alchemized my skills into one. This troupe of over 20 performers is made up of athletes, models, dancers, circus performers, and most importantly, OCEAN LOVERS. They all have backgrounds in swim team, water polo, surfing, free-diving, ocean conservation, lifeguarding, springboard diving, and scuba diving.  To round it all out, I have created seacreatre characters too! These include the fire-trident-spinning Neptune, the contortionist/aerialist hermit crab, the dancing seadragons, the little person octopus queen, the opera singing siren serpent queen, the stilting jellyfish and the trick-lining electric eel!

In creating Mermaid Theatre, it has become immanently clear that the only way to bring our messages about ocean conservation via Mermaid and Seacreature shows is within our own stage... which of course, needs to be a stage of water. Not every venue has a pool, a lake, a river or certainly not an ocean. Hummm. What can we do? Ta da! THE PORTABLE MERQUARIUM! 

Please help us spread the messages that help us play our part in saving our Mother Earth and her Daughter Ocean. 

From Fluke to Fin

In order to build a MerQuarium we needed to hire a private engineer (as these aren't readily available on Amazon.. ha ha). We hired James Oliver, www.linkedin.com/pub/oliver-jim/1a/102/38b, who is a mechanical engineer currently working for a spa company building spas. So, someone who is part of our team who currently engineers the creation of water containers for people. Couldn't be more perfect than that, right? 

We are seeking $22,000. The breakdown goes like this:

~Engineering (hiring James to create the design): $3,000

~Fabrication (creating the MerQuarium & all the supplies needed to do it with): $12,000

~Trailer to Haul the MerQuarium: $5,000

~Fundraising Costs: $2,000

Grand total= $22,000

The Treasures

If you help us, we would like to gift you! Indiegogo calls these "PERKS". So, perk up people, we have some great swag for you starting with the $5 donors for an original Iridescence mermaid sticker. Or the $40 donor tier for an awesome seashell bra hand-crafted by our Iridescence team. Last and certainly not least, the top notch $2500 donor perk for a day-trip boat adventure, captained by one of our Merfriends to Catalina Island, to swim and be filmed with our  magical Mermaids.

The Big Blue

In true essence of a symbiotic relationship with our planet and the people we share it with, you too, gain much out of this campaign besides "PERKS". What you gain from this is witnessing beautiful, athletic mermaids, mermen and seacreatures perform in your school parking lot, at your favorite convention or festival near you. But better than this is feeling like you are a  part of the solution to the ocean problems like seismic testing that is leaving thousands of marine animals stranded on beaches with their ear drums blown, turtles wrapped in the thousands of miles of drift nets, or pounds of plastic being eaten by whales and getting lodged in their intestines. You are now supporting an altruistic cause and not just another gimmick or video game developer. 

I understand that every corner we turn, there is another friend, environmental group or wildlife cause that we can all donate too. Sometimes we are just tapped out at the moment of asking. But your donation power doesn't have to end there. Share and post our project and better yet, talk about it! Word of mouth is the most powerful promotion tool that any business can have. 

    Stormy Waters

    If we don't make our $22,000 goal, there are many other things that our troupe can benefit greatly from. The tails that we use are made of 100% silicone and usually cost $3000 and upwards. We currently have a EFX guy that we use for our tail repairs but he has offered to make us a mold and begin to create new tails for less than the usual fee that most other tail makers request. We will be commissioning him for our next tails so we will keep the business local. Also, transportation to and from gigs and festivals has been quite a challenge with all of our huge props and tails. Therefore, I have a used mini motor home (like a Dolphin or Winnebago) in mind as our MerMobile that will cost around $5000-8000. Or better yet, we will hold onto what we raised, try again and bring in new demographics of people to appeal to. 

    The only perceived challenge that I anticipate having to hurdle is where to store the MerQuarium. But the good news is that I've already spoken with circus producer friends who own warehouses and they are game for us to store the tank in their facility or parking lots... some for barter of use for their other watery productions and photo shoots.  So there will be other performance uses by our circus community for this beauty. As far as risks, life is a risk and anything worth having is risky! I am a mermaid who has already taken many in my lifetime and I intend on taking many more. With that we bid you best fishes to you and your family!

    Love, Namaste, Aloha, 

    Chantel Durelli

story:
Unyfi is a comedic live rock show that brings YOU, the audience into chaos!

Will you become a superhero?  Will you join the radical hippy in protesting against DC corruption?  Will you be fired by CEO Joe in his evil boardroom? Priscilla Prissy will look at your diamond ring to see if you are in her league!  And Milo likes those pretty girls - beware of his flirtatious and seductive pick up lines!  There is some cash to be earned - and easy to be had.  Will you party with us in the world of fluff?

Unyfi is a one-time event at Club Oberon in Harvard Square February 6th, 2015. 

Unyfi premired at the Regent Theatre June 10th, 2013. The show was well received and artistically successful.  We redesigned the script to be more dynamic, fun, and audience centered.  Its gonna be a blast! 

Please contribute and buy your VIP tickets upfront through Indiegogo (each $30 donation = a VIP ticket) ! 

If you are unable to purchase tickets and attend this show please spread the word to make this an exciting event!!

Thanks for your support!! :)

-Lefko
story_txt:
Unyfi is a comedic live rock show that brings YOU, the
audience into chaos!
Will you become a superhero? 
Will you join the radical hippy in protesting against DC corruption?  Will you be fired by CEO Joe in his evil
boardroom? Priscilla Prissy will look at
your diamond ring to see if you are in her league!  And
Milo likes those pretty girls - beware of his flirtatious and seductive pick up
lines!  There is some cash to be earned
- and easy to be had.  Will you party
with us in the world of fluff? 
Unyfi is a one-time event at Club Oberon in Harvard Square
February 6th, 2015.  
Unyfi premired at the Regent Theatre June 10th, 2013. The show was well received and artistically successful.  We redesigned the script to be more dynamic, fun, and audience centered.  Its gonna be a blast! 
Please contribute and buy your VIP tickets upfront through Indiegogo (each $30 donation = a VIP ticket) ! 
If you are unable to purchase tickets and attend this show please spread the word to make this an exciting event!! Thanks for your support!! :)-Lefko

story:
The Show: Slant

This spring, I wrote and performed my first ever solo show entitled Slant in the Marion Kleinau Theatre at Southern Illinois University, Carbondale, under the direction of Craig Gingrich Philbrook. Emily Dickinson’s famous line, “Tell all the truth but tell it slant--” inspires this 60 minute performance that explores the risky endeavor of telling stories, true stories. Slant asks what can be seen from the slant of falling, of failing, and of “risking ourselves precisely at moments of unknowingness” (Judith Butler). Drawing from performance Artist Bas Jan Ader and writers like Joan Didion, and Jack Halberstam, this solo performance is a bricolage of stories, poetry, and images about falling down, falling from grace, and falling in ______.


The Dream: Australia

I've always loved traveling and performing, but doing both at the same time? Never have I ever. So imagine my delight when I was invited to perform Slant at the Critical Autoethnography Conference at Monash University in Melbourne, Australia. This opportunity to share my first solo show with this talented group of international artists and scholars and get their critical/creative feedback seems too good to miss. So, I've got a theatre, I've got an audience, and I've got a place to stay. I've just got to get to Australia and feed myself for 10 days. That's where I hope you come in.

The Cost: $3,000

Your contributions will help me cover the travel costs for my trip including:

  • Round trip ticket from St. Louis, MO to LAX  $500
  • Round trip ticket from LAX to Melbourne Australia  $1,500
  • Travel Insurance $100
  • Conference fee $50
  • Equipment repair/travel gear $200
  • Additional bag fee for props/costumes/projector/set pieces $50
  • Food/activity money $600

The Goods & Services

3,000 dollars seems like a lot of money to ask for, I realize, so I'm offering a few  creative goods and services in return for your contributions including:

  • A mini comic designed from the stop motion animations in the show
  • A chapbook of 10 original poems (including one from the show)
  • An 8.5 x 11 signed poster of the show
  • A signed script
  • A 1/2 hour or 1 hour photo shoot with edited photographs


The Risk

I suppose I take a risk here, asking my creative community to support this project in this way. They might think I'm asking too much, offering too little, being a bit selfish, or vain. However, if this show has taught me something, it is trust. I trust those of you who care about me and my work to take this invitation as just that, an invitation, not an obligation. If, for some reason, I don't make my goal, I will find other ways of raising this money (i.e. playing my guitar on the corner, making paintings to sell at the farmers market, taking my yo-yo ballet skills to the streets of Carbondale), but I thought I'd give this crowd sourcing thing a try.


Thanks for your time and support,

A.B.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Troy Couillard. I am an emerging theatre professional passionate about the future of theatre in this city. We are absolutely overflowing with brand new talent, eager and excited to get their work out in front of the eyes of the citizens. I have assembled twenty acts ranging from plays to dance pieces, poetry, social experiments, comedians, musicians and even an installation to showcase just what these artists have to offer. The festival will happen from July 22nd to August 2nd in the Motel in the Epcor Centre for the Performing Arts. 

What We Need & What You Get

What I need to make this work as smoothly as possible I need $3,000 dollars. This will be money used towards: rehearsal space, props, costumes and a small honorarium for the artists. Now ANY amount will be helpful and able to make this festival an enjoyable and successful experience. Additionally, extra funds will be used to fund next year's theatre season from Search Tower Company. 

Now, for your help there are perks. Perhaps free tickets might tickle your fancy. Nope? Your name in the program, maybe? Extra entries into prize draws free of charge?  Well, if that doesn't float your boat, how about the chance to hop up on stage and introduce a night of performances? Any of these things are up for grabs. All it takes is a donation!!!!!

The Impact

This project is important because the world is slowly becoming digital, not that there is anything wrong with that. But these musicians, writers, directors and artists still have a strong, fierce beating heart and because of their strength and bravery to put their work out into the world, they deserve their day in the sun. With your help, their day in the sun could let to magnificent opportunities for them in the future. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Now, there is more ways to help than just money! By spreading the word and getting people excited and interested in the project is worth its weight in gold. In addition to spreading the word over the city, we will also need people to help put up posters and help out during the festival with set-ups and such. Any amount of help that we can get will be considered a win!
